Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.3: PRODUCTION STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequentialobservation number used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation(layer) that is contributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.4: STATUS_ID: Unique identifier for a status
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: END TIME: The time of day that this status ended.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: PERCENT CAPABILITY: The working capability, compared to the maximum possibleexpected. This will enable the capture of a measurement representing the operationalcapacity associated with the status. Percent Capacity is normally calculated at thewell site or facility based on equipment manufacturer specifications, well operationsparameters, etc.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: START TIME: The time of day that this status first started.
Column Comment.14: PRODUCTION STRING FORMATION STATUS: A list of valid status types for aproduction string formation, qualified by a status type column.
Column Comment.15: STATUS DATE: Date the status was reported.
Column Comment.16: PRODUCTION STRING FORMATION STATUS TYPE: The type of status reported atthe production string formation, such as completion status.
Column Comment.17: TIMEZONE: the timezone that the start and end time are referenced to.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
